comments.body:
you caught me. ðŸ˜‰

I just used that as a temporary hack to work around a bug I hadn't quite figured out while watching alpha go last night; I needed to get this in before Adam's big patch lest I get into conflict hell.

I actually have this fixed locally already now. It'll be in my next patch which finishes the type work.

It is true that `type_argument_not_matching_bounds` is not related to strong mode. I suspect you want this rule enabled, but it might be expedient to ignore it in this CL and then re-enable it in a separate CL that also contains fixes for the rule.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@    strong_mode_static_type_error: ignore
    strong_mode_down_cast_composite: ignore
    type_argument_not_matching_bounds: ignore
    # we allow having TODOs in the code
    todo: ignore

comments.body: I notice this is a small subset of the lint rules enumerated in `flutter_analysis_options`.  Curious what the rationale is?  I would have expected them all % `public_member_api_docs`?
I didn't want another copy of that file to maintain :) I just need the few that I hit on a regular basis (and see failures on travis with).
